# Introduction

As we know, data science is an interdisplinary field. My personal definition of data science is the problem-solving process of using data munging, data analytics and data visualization to generate actionable insights. There is just so much to explore. This is by no means a comprehensive and most relevant list for learning Data Science. So open for suggestions!  


# Blogs
- [R-Bloggers](https://www.r-bloggers.com/)
- [rOpenSci](http://ropensci.org/blog/)
- [Kaggle's Blog - No Free Lunch](http://blog.kaggle.com/)
- [Forecasting by Rob J Hyndman](http://robjhyndman.com/hyndsight/forecasting/)
- [Statistical Modeling, Causal Inference, and Social Science](http://andrewgelman.com/)
- [Variance Explained](http://varianceexplained.org/)
- [FiveThirtyEight](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/)
- [Simply Statistics](http://simplystatistics.org/)
